events.details: I just published a small technical blog post on Independent Component Communication in Angular.

Will be presenting a research on Assistive Technology in Lyon, France at the reputed Web4All conference on 24th of April. The paper is titled "Accessify: An ML Powered Application to Automatically Provide Image Descriptions on Website" co authored with Nishith and Anurag

Recently participated in a unique research based hackathon, HACKEAM18, organised by NSIT, New Delhi. Healthcare treks and 24 hrs of non-stop coding. All experiences well documenetd by Anurag in the details.
A published research paper presented in IEEE SSCI 2017, Honolulu, Hawaii, USA
Will be speaking on the WebApps and AR at JSLovers event.
Will be attempting my second jump at a height of 160 mts in Nepal near China border.
Presented a paper as speaker at Grace Hopper Celebration India 2017, Bangalore on 16th November 2017
Attended Artificial Intelligence Bootcamp India 2017, Microsoft, Gurgaon on 23rd September 2017

allPhotoBlogData.caption: Big Black Coffee & Blog
allPhotoBlogData.quote: Dreams and Nightmares are the same, its just a matter of attachment with our memories.
allPhotoBlogData.detail:
I have been an admirer of great delicacies for long now. Well, Black Coffee? I guess a new acquired taste. Shuns your mind for a while, leaves you in a blank state for a moment and when you regain yourself, you are new, atleast for a moment.
Sitting somewhere surrounded by lush green mountains, calm and quiet.

allPhotoBlogData.caption: So much for faith, atleast they have it.
allPhotoBlogData.quote: Innocence is like a dumb leper who has lost his bell, wandering the world, meaning no harm. -by Graham Greene
allPhotoBlogData.detail: This quote by Mr.Greene is what describes these poeple of failth, the best. Looking to an almighty who might, or might not, listen to their problems and show a solution. A small town surrounded by mountains in lap of the Holy Ganga(it's not called Ganges as it is best known outside my country).

allPhotoBlogData.caption: An engineering marvel
allPhotoBlogData.quote: The lights, the people, the birdge, their faith and their emotions. All at one place.
allPhotoBlogData.detail: A hanging bridge, thus a Jhoola. Thousands of people cross by everyday, some for the sake of worship, others for fun. The famous German bakery is on the city side at start of the bridge. If not talking to a just met Israeli friend, you can enjoy the view from the brdige. Yes, many foreigners visit Rishiskesh, especially from Israel.

allPhotoBlogData.caption: Evil at the hand of justice
allPhotoBlogData.detail:
The sholka means 'Dharma is so called because it sustains or supports society'.
Unintetionally witnessed this Ravana-Dahan scene at Ghats acompained by a lot of fire crackers.

allPhotoBlogData.caption: The Jump
allPhotoBlogData.quote: Someday among these birds, you will find yourself flying
allPhotoBlogData.detail: The highest jump site in India, 83 meters. A breath-taking view, nature at it's best and a perfect place to start the bucketlist. The leap of a plutonian as I would call it.

allPhotoBlogData.caption: Unending Roads
allPhotoBlogData.quote: Woods are lovely dark and deep, but I have promises to keep.
allPhotoBlogData.detail: Roads. Miles traveled. Miles remaining. It's not the same and it won't be but still it's the road. :)

allPhotoBlogData.caption: A walk on waters
allPhotoBlogData.quote: The most toughest terrains are crosssed by will.
allPhotoBlogData.detail: Somewhere deep in terrains of Shivpuri, Rishikesh. Surrounded by lush green mountains. Perfect place to write, think and relax.

allPhotoBlogData.caption: A solo traveller
allPhotoBlogData.quote: Silence has it's own music, cozy to the ears.
allPhotoBlogData.detail: Imagine Dragons combined with this serene beauty in solitary. Thoughts, diary, bucketlists and countless memories

allPhotoBlogData.caption: A beach, The river.
allPhotoBlogData.quote: Nature is the most ruthless teacher.
allPhotoBlogData.detail: Found this almost-deserted river beach far from Rishikesh. Mostly untouched by human-hands and a marvel of nature.
